chargeHist.descr: Arson of Property Other Than Building

result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew I. Hubbard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Arson of Property Other Than Building [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.03.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with ELCA Facility.  DOC shall promptly notify the court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Zach Brost appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody pro se.  Report has been received which states the deft is now competent to proceed.  State concurs with the findings in the report.  Deft concurs with the findings in the report.  Deft wishes to proceed pro se with the SEHR.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 3yrs WSP followed by 2yrs of ES.  ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.  Credit for 516 days.
Return to sender.  Refused.  Not in custody.  Notice of hearing filed 11-1-17 returned by post office
of atty fees due $70 within 30 days or civil judgment
Hearing on November 13, 2017 at 10:00 am.
from Wisc. Forensic Unit
for payment of atty fees $70.
for discharge of atty Lawrence

Atty Kyle Lawrence, advocate counsel, atty fees of $70.00.00 dos 030217-082317
1.0 hrs
for Treatment (Incompetency) CR-206

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody pro se.  Deft does wish to speak with an atty; Atty Carl Johnson attempted to speak w/deft but the deft refused to speak with Atty Johnson.  Report has been received from Dr. Rawski which states the deft is not competent at this time.  State concurs with the findings in Dr. Rawski.  Court finds the deft is not competent at this time but is likely to become competent within the time prescribed by law.  Deft is committed to the Dept of Health Services.  Medication ordered is required.  Proceedings are suspended at this time.
Email sent to Michelle P requesting someone go interview the deft to see if he qualifies for their representation

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody.  Clerk contacted PD's office - no one has been to seen the deft.  Clerk Lema informed the PD's office that an email was sent to Michelle P. on 7/6/17.  Status conf adj to 7/27/17 @ 2:15pm.  Clerk Lema sent an email to the PD's office.
Email sent to Michelle P requesting someone interview the deft to see if he qualifies for their representation

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody pro se.  Court briefly questioned the deft.  Deft reports he is now willing to speak with the PD's office to see if he qualifies for the representation.  FP set for 7/24/17 @ 2:30pm.
From Dr Robert Rawski MD

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody pro se.  Deft does not want counsel.  Report received from Dr. Rawski which states he failed to cooperate for the second time.  However, Dr. Rawski reports he does not believe the deft is competent to proceed at this time but is likely to become competent w/in the time allowed by law.  State concurs with the findings in Dr. Rawski's report.  Deft reports he doesn't understand.  CH set for 7/6/17 @ 11am.  Doctor may testify via telephone.

For Competency Exam
(Form CR-205)

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody.  No report received from Dr. Rawski.  Clerk contacted Dr. Rawski - he did not receive the voice mail message which was left.  Dr. Rawski suggested another order be prepared.  FP adj to 6/12/17 @ 11:30am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody pro se.  Deft wishes to proceed pro se.  Report has been received from Dr. Rawski.  Brief discussion held on whether the court should order an in-patient evaluation based on the deft's lack of cooperation with Dr. Rawski.  Deft states he will be cooperative.  FP set for 5/31/17 @ 9:30am.  Clerk Lehman left voice mail message for Dr. Rawski re: next hrg date and the deft stated he would be cooperative.
from Dr. Rawski
Cover Sheet for Confidential Records
Per Judge - Faxed revocation order packet to WFU.

For Competency Exam - For CR 205.
Comp order sent to Br 3 for signature

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody pro se.  Deft refused to speak with Atty Kyle Lawrence.  Court questions the deft's competence.  15 day competency evaluation ordered.  FP set for 5/16/17 @ 1:15pm

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Deft has refused to come to court or participate in a telephone conference.  SEHR adj to 5/1/17 @ 3:30pm.  Clerk sent email to conveyance notifying them of the next court date.

email received from conveyance that the deft is refusing to come out of his cell or come to court.  In addition - deft refused to participate in a telephone conference with the court as well.  Also, the court received received an email from Atty Kyle Lawrence - deft refused to meet with Atty Lawrence at the jail.
Due to an ongoing jury trial, SEHR on 3/14/17 at 1:15 reset for 4/6/17 at 2:45.  Atty Lawrence given the date in person; D.A. given new date via email.
Email sent to Atty Kyle Lawrence with next court date

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody pro se.  Deft wishes to proceed w/o counsel.  Court conducts colliquey with deft.  After some discussion, Court decides to appoint advocate counsel and sets the case over to 3/14/17 @ 1:15pm.  Court suggested that the deft at least speak with the atty even if he still wishes to proceed pro se at the next hrg.

Screen 77 (CACU-I77C) w/copy of Revocation Order and Warrant; filed by Dept of Corr/Probation&Parole.   Defendant revoked on 1/31/17; to be returned to court for sentencing.  ZERO PAID ON PROBATION - ALL COSTS STILL DUE.
DOC to keep court informed of the new charges in Illinois as well as any action taken by DOC due to this violation.  Email sent to Agent Julia Starr

email received from Agent Julia Starr - deft was arrested by Antioch Police Dept on 11/13/16; currently in custody in Illinois with local charges of Criminal Trespass to Bldg and Criminal Trespass to Land (scanned into 11-14-16 notes entry)
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
deft refused to sign

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Terry Rose.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Court imposes an add'l 11 days KCJ commencing today as a condition of probation.
Sentencing hearing on April 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Terry Rose.  Victim rights compliance.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 4/13/16 @ 2:15pm.  State will provide the parties with the deft's prior convictions at the next hrg.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Terry Rose.  Atty Rose reports he was recently appointed; however he submitted a proposal to the State today to resolve the case.  State requests time to review this offer.  FPT adj to 3/9/16 @ 1:15pm.

Scheduling Order

Defendant, Andrew I. Hubbard, appeared.  Attorney James Steven Kraus appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  Court questions DE about his waiver of an attorney.  DE insists that he has waived his right to an attorney and does not want to consult an attorney to represent him.    State is compliant with victim rights notification.  ST called witness KPD Ofc Steve Winter; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by DE. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial in Br 3. Before the arraignment Court questions DE again about waiving his right to an attorney; DE again states he waives his right.  Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 10:10 am.  Jury selection scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Andrew I. Hubbard in court, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer A. Phan appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:   DE waives his right to counsel.  State's witness is unavailable today due to an emergency. State requests an adjournment.  Court tolls time limits.   Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 30, 2015 at 08:45 am.

*No Contact w/ ELCA Outreach Center 6218 26th Ave
943.03 - Arson of property other than building / Repeater

1:38 pm    Special Prosecutor Attorney Daniel Tombasco  appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Clerk:  JT.  Deft waives his right to counsel.    Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on  12-23-15 @ 10:15.  $10000 cash bondset wtih conditions.
and witness list filed by the State
